snippet: The “National Day of Struggle,” organized by labor unions and focusing on issues like wages and benefits, disrupted ports and blocked some highways essential to commerce.
abstract: One-day nationwide general strike in Brazil, 'National Day of Struggle,' organized by labor unions is meant to capitalize on wave of mass demonstrations across the country in June; action produces mixed results, with some cities and states disrupted severely and others largely unaffected.
lead_paragraph: The “National Day of Struggle,” organized by labor unions and focusing on issues like wages and benefits, disrupted ports and blocked some highways essential to commerce.

headline.main: Brazil’s Workers Take to Streets in One-Day Strike
headline.print_headline: Brazil’s Workers Take to Streets in One-Day Strike
